Reinhold Andreas Steinbeck

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/5804563500068107
  • Última atualização do currículo em 21/10/2013

Reinhold Steinbeck is a Learning Designer and International Educational Development Specialist who has developed, directed, and evaluated innovative programs in secondary and higher education that have been implemented in Africa, Asia, South America, and the U.S. Mr. Steinbeck has directed programs that operate at the intersections between the science, practice, and technology of learning and teaching. The programs include globally distributed and blended learning scenarios, and span multiple disciplines, ranging from education, health, environmental sustainability, to innovation and entrepreneurship. He is principally interested in applying design thinking and creative problem-solving methodologies to empower communities to improve their socioeconomic conditions through education and development. Steinbeck was with Stanford University for over 15 years, serving as Associate Director of Learning Design with the Stanford Learning Lab and Director of the International Program with the Stanford Center for Innovations in Learning (SCIL). Most recently, he founded and directed the International Outreach Program (IOP), an academic start-up which served as a bridge between Stanford University and institutions of higher education around the world. He is currently founding Co-Director of the Laboratório de Design, Inovação e Criatividade (d-USPLeste) and Visiting Professor at the Universidade de São Paulo (USP). d-USPLeste is a new multi-disciplinary innovation program that applies human-centered and team-based approaches to developing innovative solutions to a variety of real-world problems in low-income urban communities. (Texto informado pelo autor)
